utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Hi, kids.

utterance.speaker: Daughter
utterance.content: Mommy, look what I made.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Oh, wow. It's a farmer and a cow and some horses. It's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Daughter
utterance.content: It's for Ted's office.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Oh, he's gonna love it. And it’d be nice if you called him Dad. Give me a big hug.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: The secret is the Hass avocados. I can e-mail you the recipe if you want. Oh, this is the third time they've changed plans since Friday. These idiots think you can just add a 14th floor and the mayor won't notice.

utterance.speaker: Friend
utterance.content: I thought turning the garage into a nursery was complicated. Any luck on your end yet?

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Not for lack of trying. Ted.

utterance.speaker: Friends
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: I have to go tell a client he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Go kick some ass.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: I have to take Stella to karate by 3:00 and birthday party at Julia's after.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Yeah, I'll be back. Just make sure she's dressed. Ah!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's actually on time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's six minutes early.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Something's happened.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm on it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Morning, Jimmy. Anybody die while I was gone?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Did -- did you iron your shirt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thought about shaving; couldn't find a razor.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What the hell happened in Baltimore?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, chief. I never kiss and tell.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think you just did.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: there's no such thing as "just a kiss."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you iron *your* shirt? Everybody's flash today.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Has she left Mark? Is she going to?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think I can hear cancer kids calling.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you planning on asking her to leave Mark?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not sure. Cameron keeps my calendar.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey. This is a big deal. This is an affair. Have you even talked to Stacy about what the hell this means?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't have a lot of time for talking. If you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Great. Breaking up a marriage; fertile ground for high comedy. We need to talk about this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gosh, wish I could. How did the HIV test go? Did you study up?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: I rescheduled for this afternoon. We have a new patient. 34-year-old female. Movement disorder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Movement disorder? Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This isn't just gonna go away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. But maybe you will.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Probably suffered head trauma in the car accident. Trauma leads to the dyskinesia.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: According to her husband, the flailing started before she got anywhere near that car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What does the flailing look like?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her arms spasm uncontrollably and there's a mild facial twitch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Demonstration?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You wanna know what it looks like, go see the patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ooo, snarky. Was he like this the whole time I was gone?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Patient's been on a fertility regimen for the last 13 months. Excess estrogen in the system could explain--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who finished the animal crackers?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sudden movement disorder could be a symptom of Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you finish something, don't just put back the empty box, throw it out.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Huntington's takes a day to confirm. We should put her on Tamoxifen in case it is the fertility meds. Counteract the estrogen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a great idea, if you want to kill her baby. Movement disorder can present in the first trimester.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's not pregnant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Peeing on a stick is only 99% accurate. Get a real pregnancy test. You know, the one with the blood and the hormones and the rabbit. Oh, I'm sorry. It's still your limo. Whaddya say, Miss Daisy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lame duck's done quacking.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You quack, people shoot at you. Cuddy just put me here to make you miserable. Another two days, you can go back to making yourself miserable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Get an MRI. See if it's in her head, or in her uterus. You're gonna want to paralyze her. You run tests on a flailer, somebody's gonna lose an eye.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: You think I'm pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: We need to find out for sure.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Would all this go away once she delivered?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It could also be neurological. We need to get an MRI.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Can she do that if she's pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: The risk to the fetus is extremely low.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: But there is a risk. I-I don’t think we should do it until we're sure. Ah! Ted, I think you should take Stella home.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I want to stay here. We should be with you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You should take her out of the room. We're going to temporarily stop Margo's spasms.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You can do that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Vecuronium. It's a paralytic. Essentially cuts off the brain from the muscles. Don't worry. Your mom will be just fine.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: It'll make running the tests easier. And it won't be dangerous for the baby if you are pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Let's go, Stella.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: I want to be with Mommy.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: We'll be just outside, okay? We gotta let the doctors get her better, alright?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: It's okay sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Love you.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Love you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your vitals will be watched closely. I'm going to close your lids so your eyes don't dry out. Just try to relax.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What the hell did you do? Were you just cold and lonely?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Course he told you, he's an 8-year-old boy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey, you're the one who kissed him.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Why are you so worked up over this?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because you're married.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Not to you. This is none of your business.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The last time you left, I was the one stuck picking up the pieces.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Oh right. He cried himself to sleep every night. That so sounds like him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's been *pining* for five years!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You're being dramatic.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. Actually, I'm underplaying. This is me being restrained.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It was one kiss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Are you being intentionally thick? This was not just a one-night stand. You can't toy with him.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I'm not. He's probably toying with me. I do--I don't know what I'm doing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, boy.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Welcome back to the world. You're off the Vecuronium.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: could you wiggle your toes for me?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: The MRI was clear. Whatever this is isn't in your brain.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: The MRI...so I'm not pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: So what do we do next?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It could be a variety of things, some treatable; others more serious. Open up. We're gonna run a genetic test for Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: That one of the more serious ones?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: It's also possible that this is just a symptom of the fertility treatments. Now that we know you're not pregnant, we're going to start you on Tamoxifen to counteract the estrogen.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Will that undo all the fertility treatments?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: For the time being, yeah. But it could cure you.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: You can start trying again once we get you healthy.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: DAMN IT!

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: The spasms are going to get worse now that the Vecuronium’s wearing off.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: What are you so scared of? I'm still your mother, I'm just a little sick. Why did you even bring her here? I told you to leave her at home!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hyper-vigilance, sudden irritability...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Symptomatic of… lunch with Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The patient now defines Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then what do you need me for? Start her on Huntington's meds.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Before we get her test results back? If we start her on valproic acid, it could destroy her liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we wait, she could progress to full blown psychosis. Then her kid will never get the chance to say goodbye. Wanna tell the class how that feels?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Huntington's patients don't progress to psychosis in a day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She went from 0 to 60 in world-record time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Indicating it might be something other than Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We got a problem.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Stay away from me! Where's my daughter?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's happening?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's having a psychotic break.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: No! She's not yours! What do you want with her?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Calm down!

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Honey...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Margo, you're gonna hurt someone.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Push two milligrams Ativan!

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: How can her Huntington's test be negative?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: All the signs are there. Movement disorder, psychosis... It should be Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. That'd certainly make your job easier. Well good news for Margo, it's not Huntington's. Bad news for us, the psychotic break eliminates fertility meds; which means we have no idea what's wrong with her. We give you so much, and you give so little!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know patient is prime age to develop spontaneous schizophrenia.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Almost impossible. No family history of mental illness.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How about toxins?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: None of her family members are sick, nobody at her office, her volunteer group, kid's classes, and PTA members. All fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So she raises a daughter, runs a business, she does charity work, she volunteers at school, attends PTA. What makes mommy run?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're thinking drugs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cocaine. Explains the psychosis and the flailing, and the uncanny ability to bring home the bacon, fry it up in a pan, and never ever let Teddy forget that he's a man.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: I'll go look for her stash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take Foreman. There's gotta be a reason for the stereotype.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know you're in there. I can hear you caring.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The door was locked.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Means I didn't want to see anyone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: High school reunion?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's for a patient. She can't roll. Now lock that door, too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Paranoia; must be the good stuff. Times like these I wish I had cancer. So what did she say?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That depends. What did you do, and who are we talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We both know that as soon as we talked you ran to Stacy so you could gossip and giggle. I need to know what she said.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have a crazy idea: why don't you go talk to her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because my bestest buddy says that could lead to trouble.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She sounds confused, but I don’t' think she is. I think she's waiting for you to do something to show her you're serious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. It's a big jump from infidelity is morally wrong to "do her."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't say *do* her. I said do *something.*

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What exactly did she say?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She didn't say it was a mistake.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not gonna leave Mark in the middle of his rehab; too much guilt.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She left you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Harsh toke, dude.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Killjoy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I could've covered this. You need to get that test today.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: I wish you guys would remember my birthday instead of my HIV test.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Forgive us for being concerned. I got a bet with House. He says you're too scared to get it, I say you're too anal not to. I'll cut you in.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: That was a colossal waste.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Who would've known? Searching a high-end family home for illicit narcotics was such an obvious choice.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Working moms practically live in their cars.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Little bump on the run?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: You were a car thief right? Ha. Momma's little helper.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: House! Ritalin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cocaine with a PG rating.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Prescribed to her daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mommy does everything for her family these days. Even swallows their pills.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's possible the kid's meds are the kid's meds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pop enough Ritalin, it can explain everything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, Ritalin maybe explains some tics, some involuntary--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, case reports have referred to chorea. She's been cut off from her stash, so the flailing's tapered off and the psychosis hasn't returned. It's perfect.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Tox screen will confirm that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Half-life's 12 hours. The drugs'll be out of her system. We're done. Get rid of her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're not done. We have to confirm the diagnosis before we send her home to die of something else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh yes, the power tastes so sweet. You just can't resist. You're like a diabetic at the ice cream counter. You want to say no, but you need that chocolaty goodness.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, I'm still signing the charts. So until tomorrow, you're not allowed to kill anyone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wuss.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: We've asked her three times if she's on any meds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we don't ask *her.*

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Candy striper. So, you like dogs?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: That's not a dog.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Smart kid. Are you always such a good little girl? Or does mommy sometimes say you're the reason she needs a double martini?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Over here, kiddo. I'm talking to you. Focus. It must be because you're off your meds.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Who *are* you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doctor *and* candy striper.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: She's not on any medication.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well that's strange, because this bottle has her name on it. And I think these are medical pills inside.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's he talking about?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Doctor prescribed Stella… a few months ago. I never told you about it because I never gave her any.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. That's funny, 'cause the bottle's almost empty. You missed a couple of days. Take five.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Stop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why? Unless they're not hers. You need some water, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: I'm not taking Ritalin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on. All the cool moms are doing it. And tox screen says you're cool too.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You were on drugs while taking care of Stella?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Ted. It's a cafeteria menu.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Should take a couple of hours to process her. Then you can take her home and divorce her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Working late? Or are you just avoiding Mark?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It was one kiss, Greg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So far. I'm planning on keeping a chart.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I'm moving back to Short Hills, I think it's time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're leaving?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It's never meant to be permanent. And now that Mark's getting better…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Much better. Except for the whole walking thing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He needs to get back to work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right; saving the next generation from making bad choices about acne cream. You're running away because the kiss meant something.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I'm not running away. I'm going home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With Mark.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I love Mark.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You love me more. I don't want you to leave.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Are we okay? I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Let's just get you home.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: That's a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Mommy!

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Call the code.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: What's wrong, Mommy?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This better be important.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: You've gotta come back in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No I don't.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Margo's stable, but--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Well, I'll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: She had a stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfect. Gotta go back to work.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Right now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, patient's stable. Could maybe wait a half hour.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: He should have been here 20 minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doubt if he makes it at all. I saw him leave with Stacy.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: He's probably just walking her to her car.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. That sounds like House.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: He's not an idiot. He's not gonna hook up with a married woman.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I hope he is getting some. Maybe he'll mellow out.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: What took you so long? It's midnight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Traffic. Cinco de Mayo. You owe me a 100 bucks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You didn't take the test?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fear trumps anal every time.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: It's not a big deal. I had the viral load and antibody tests. It's 99.9% that I don't have HIV.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have the test and it's negative, you gain a tenth of a point. But if it's positive you lose… nearly 100, right?

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: No arrhythmia. So Ritalin isn't the big problem. Something else is going on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Let's play doctors.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I removed the clot which caused the stroke. Problem is, we don't know where it came from.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Did ultrasounds of her heart, arms, and legs. All clear.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could be a protein C deficiency.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Wouldn't explain the movement disorder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing explains everything. What if it's a crime syndicate? Let's say Ritalin and the fertility meds plotted a caper. Ritalin takes care of the psychosis, the flailing--

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I still don't think Ritalin--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fertility meds are competitive by nature. They gotta do something bigger. Something really unexpected.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Fertility treatments have been known to cause endometrial cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which could cause clots. Which could have caused her to stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So ultrasound her uterus this time. See if there's something growing in there that doesn't look adorable in a onesie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron. I love you. Get your test results tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: The prescription for my heart condition; a bit on the cheesy side.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was trying for romantic. Still fits.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you tell Mark?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I told him I had to work late.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You going to tell him?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Am I going to tell him? Still working on that phrasing. How about; 'Know all that stuff you were worried about when we first came here, honey? You were right.'

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pithy.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Everything's easy when you don't care if you hurt anyone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You already did the hurting part. He just doesn't know it yet.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: If I never tell him, it'll never hurt. I want not to love Mark. I want to hate you. I want all of this to be simple, but it's not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can either have a life with me, or you can have a life with him. It can't be both. It's not easy. But it is simple.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: No endometrial thickening, no masses.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's on fertility treatments. She had a blood clot. It's there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Millions of women are on fertility treatments, and they don't get cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. They get babies. She had a blood clot and a stroke. She'll get another one and probably die if we don't find that tumor. Do an endometrial biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Biopsy's painful and unnecessary. We just did an ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shh.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: If you have a personal issue that's interfering with--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shh, shh, shh, shh, shh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are we waiting for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your four weeks just expired. Your reign of terror is over. Mine is just begun. Now go stick a needle up her hoo-hoo and find that cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hoo-hoo?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He went to Hopkins.

utterance.speaker: Commentator 1
utterance.content: ...has got 1,500 horsepower blown and injected with alcohol.

utterance.speaker: Commentator 2
utterance.content: Yeah, that baby really moves.

utterance.speaker: Commentator 1
utterance.content: Oh yeah, the transmission...

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: What are you watching?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: TV. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Ted's with my mom. He asked the nurse to watch me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What nurse?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: She's not really watching me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got that.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Do you still have the balloons?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Do you want to play something?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: When can Mommy come home?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't know.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: What's wrong with your foot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: War wound.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Does it hurt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Every day.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Is that why you're so sad?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, aren't you adorable. I'm not sad. I'm complicated. Chicks dig that. One day, you'll understand.

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: That's what my parents say when they don't want me to know something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They say that a lot?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Only when they're talking about making babies and stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And when you catch them fighting?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: They don't fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not ever?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: People who love each other don't fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. Forgot that. What floor was that nurse on who was watching you?

utterance.speaker: Stella
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good talk.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: At your age the type of uterine cancer that develops is not likely to metastasize. It's very treatable.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hold still, Margo.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: I--I'm feeling a little bit dizzy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: BP's dropping.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get him out of here.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's going on??

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: Heart rate's 98 and rising.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We've gotta find that bleed.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: What'd you do, hit an artery?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: With what? I hadn't even started the procedure.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I need some advice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Whatever it is, can it wait?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Yeah. What was Greg like after I left?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Uh, an egomaniacal narcissistic pain in the ass. Same as before you left.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Do you think he's capable of having a real relationship?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What happened in Baltimore?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Maybe something.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Technically, most of the something happened after Baltimore.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh God, Stacy...

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I don't know what to do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you seriously thinking about leaving Mark?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: No. I don't know. I can't.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And you want me to tell you it's okay?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It wasn't all bad with Greg. I was with him for a reason.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You left him for a reason.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I could swear I remember him being fun.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sorry for the scare.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Just tell me she's okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ultrasound showed the bleed was coming from her liver. It's rare, but the blood got into her Fallopian tubes. In a way, it was lucky. Let us know we were looking in the wrong place. The tumor's in her liver.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Is it--is it cancer?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're running some more tests.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There it is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a liver tumor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it's malignant, at least she's only gonna leave one child without a mother. Do a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can't. It's vascular.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: I'm here about Stacy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about her?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: I think I'm losing her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your wife, your problem.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: She won't talk to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what, you're gonna talk to me instead? Talk to your shrink.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: She keeps saying everything's fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find a bar and talk to a stranger.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: You're the only one who's been through this. I'm shutting her out. I'm saying things and then hating myself for saying them. How did you get past that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Can you please be a human being for one minute and talk to me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry; gotta go, people dying.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: You're not gonna outrun me.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not ready for this.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: I've seen the way you and Stacy talk to each other.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're an idiot. You probably just set your rehab back three months.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Let go of me! Get off of me!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Liver tumor doesn't make sense.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You saying the CT was wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm saying the symptoms don't add up. A + B does not equal liver tumor. We gotta solve for X. We gotta look at this differently. What do we know about her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Side effects of the Ritalin caused the--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. We've examined the file up and down. Come here. Give me that. Why do you people always overlook the human element? What do we know about her? Margo… Dalton; the woman.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's a people pleaser. She doesn't like to let people down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Never fights with her husband.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She went to drugs instead of asking for help to manage her life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So if she can't manage now, why does she want another kid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman. Need your help here. You want to pull a bank job. Would you go it alone? If you're gonna rob a home, sure. It's a one or two man crew. But a bank. Lookout. Getaway driver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not saying anything until the metaphor plays itself out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So here's the caper. Fertility meds create a distraction. Mommy had 3 refills on the Ritalin in the last 3 weeks. That team goes straight for the top floor. Has no trouble taking out communications , but--the specialist, Safe Cracker. All he does is stroke, blood clot, liver tumor. Foreman was right. This bad ass even does flailing. Come on. Only one guy I know does that kind of work.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Birth control pills?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: While the surgeons are cutting out a chunk of your liver, should I have them do a hysterectomy too?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: A hysterectomy? I'm trying to get pregnant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't have to lie to me. We're not married. You're supermom. You can do anything. You work seven days a week. You volunteer. Raise a kid. Yet you still somehow find the time to lie to hubby number two that you really, really want to give him a child with his chin and pretty brown eyes.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: What makes you think that I don't--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because it fits. Birth control pills caused hepatocellular adenoma. Explains all your symptoms that aren't explained by your other lies.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: That's it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Also.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: I'll have the tuna on rye. Would you like to leave my room now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tumor is benign. Stop taking the pill and it'll go away on it's own. So, I'm cancelling the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: What are you going to tell my husband?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That I'm canceling the surgery. You can do the explaining. It's tricky, huh? It's one thing to say you can't have a baby. It's another to say you don't want one. Personally I'd make up some other lie.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Could--could I die on the table?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could you die if you tell him the truth?

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: I need the surgery. I'm not on the pill.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You can't cancel the surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If she goes off the pill, the tumor goes away on its own.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have no proof the birth control pills caused this, you have no proof she's even taking them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well if we do the surgery, maybe we'll kill her on the table. Then I can prove I'm right at the autopsy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Or, we can forget the surgery, let the tumor grow, and kill her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why don't you take it up with Stacy? See which option minimizes your risk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Here's what I think she's gonna say. Oh, I love Greg. But if you go against a patient's wishes, you're calling her a liar. And if something goes wrong, I end up in court having to defend the big mean doctor, albeit with dreamy eyes, who wouldn't believe the nice suburban mom. And even though his cane makes me melt, do the damn surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shocking. It's benign.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: People do crazy things for love.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Crazy is hanging out in the park all day talking to pigeons. Margo knows what she's doing. She gave up half her liver to save her marriage.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, she surgically removed her fingerprints to cover up her pathetic lie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's twisted and manipulative, I give you that. But it's also...romantic. I'm barely willing to put the seat down after I pee.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Do we need to talk?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So the surgeon got the whole tumor. And it was benign.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: That's good, right?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Benign is good.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: How could a benign tumor have caused all the symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We believe all your wife's symptoms will go away now.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Oh. Thank God. Look, I'm gonna pick up Stella. I'll call you after I get the baby-sitter.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman, you can help me. You could tell my husband that... because of all this... I can't take any more fertility treatments.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Confidentiality rules stop me from telling your husband the truth. But my obligation to lie ends there.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: Are--are there--is there a birth control method, something that won't make me sick?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Margo, you're gonna have risks with everything; especially if you're not telling your fertility doctor. If you keep doing this, it's gonna kill your marriage and kill you.

utterance.speaker: Margo
utterance.content: You don't know. In a few years, we'll give up. Stop trying to get pregnant. We'll hug; cry. Eventually, Ted will stop thinking about it. And he'll appreciate Stella even more. And we'll live happily together for the next 50 years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Something you need to see. Knowing is always better than not knowing.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: It's a referral request.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. HIV thing came in earlier. You're fine.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: You won't read your mail, but you'll open mine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It said confidential. I wanted to know.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: The most important letter of my life and you're still an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Comforting, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I'm going to talk to Mark tonight. And I'm going to stay here with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: This isn't funny Greg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You... spent all these months chasing me. Now I'm here and you start running? What the hell changed?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing changes. I'm not going to change.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Who asked you to?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mark is willing to do whatever it takes. I'm not. Never was.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Oh, now you're introspective? Weren’t so analytical the other night. [Beta Comment: My mom has this saying… about a cow and free milk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were happy with Mark. You'll be happy again.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Shut up about Mark. What the hell's wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't make you happy!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you think this is gonna end? We'll be happy for what? A few weeks, few months; and then I'll say something insensitive, or I'll start ignoring you. And at first it'll be okay. It's just House being House. And then at some point, you will need something more. You'll need someone who can give you something I can't. You know I’m right. I've been there before.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. It doesn't have to be.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It does. It does. I don’t want to go there again. I'm sorry, Stacy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 50 bucks says they're divorced in a year.

utterance.speaker: Cam
utterance.content: 6 months tops.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll take that bet. It's the perfect marriage. There's nothing to fight over if you never talk about anything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told her she's better off without me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Huh. That's probably true.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're an idiot. You don't think she'd be better off without you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. I sent her off on a whim.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have no idea why you sent her off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't do this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This was no great sacrifice! You sent her away because you've got to be miserable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That kind of psycho-crap help get your patients through the long nights? Or is it just for you? Tough love make you feel good? Helping people feel their pain?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't like yourself. But you do admire yourself. It's all you've got, so you cling to it. You're so afraid if you change, you'll lose what makes you special. Being miserable doesn't make you better than anybody else, House. It just makes you miserable.
